custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget

AND he report will have an LDAP associated with it

AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements

custom_expected:

ANd entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements

custom_expected:

AND Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
AND The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.

custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch the prompts according to the requirements
AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements

custom_expected:
THEN "Capitalized Payments by Year" report should be listed in the Report listing widget. 
AND Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements.

title: Custom Prompt for Capitalized Payments Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is attempting to run the Capitalized Payments Report from Reports Listing Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the hyperlink for the report
custom_expected:
THEN a custom UI prompt should display
AND this prompt should be styled similar to other EBIS custom UI report prompts
AND parameters should match Prompts documentation in wiki (https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=Capitalized+Payments+-+Prompts)

title: As a User, I want to view an existing Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player already has an existing Winter League Requests
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the transaction in a player's Winter League History widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window
AND Browser tab info = "WNTRQ - Last, Roster First"
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

title: As a User, I want to edit an existing Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player already has an existing Winter League Requests
custom_steps: WHEN user opens existing Winter League Requests
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit(grey) button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
AND Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save(grey) button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND Editable fields will match what is in the provided Data Discovery (Note the special behaviors)
AND A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values and reload the transaction in view mode. 
AND Required field and format checks will only be made if the transaction is in a post-Approval state.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #77.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
AND If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a BOC User, I want to create a new Winter League Request Transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on any of the Create New Icon > Minor League > Assignments > Winter League Request
OR Create New Icon > Major League > Assignments > Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN system will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Request for the same player 
AND If a preliminary transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction.
OR If no preliminary transaction already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND The status of preliminary will display in red on the form in view and edit mode
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a BOC user, I want to submit a Winter League Request to Club
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in to submit a Winter League request to club
custom_steps: WHEN BOC has the preliminary form in edit mode or view mode.
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to Club button will be available on the form.The button is blue. 
AND Clicking Submit to Club will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. (Global error messaging, modal, pinned errors, red highlight for missing required fields)
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Pending to Club"  
AND The status "Pending to Club" appears in green on the form in view and edit mode.
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful approve blue notification. Messages #76.
AND No entry is added to the player's player history.  
AND An Approval item should be generated for BOC Users
AND An Action Item should be generated for Club Users 

NOTE: This is not a standard transaction and should not be subject to the standard rule checks (similar to DL Recertifications)

title: As a User, I want to view a player's Winter League Request History on their profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Professional Players profile
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Transaction Tab
custom_expected:
THEN "Winter League Request History" will be displayed on the last collapsible section. 
AND it will be expanded by default.
AND Inside the section will be a widget that matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/waivers___transactions.html
AND Pending requests should appear in green
OR If no Winter League Requests exist for the player the section header still going to display but there won't be any table (including the table headers).

title: As a User, I want to Grant a Winter League Request Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Winter League Request is in pending state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing or Editing the request
custom_expected:
THEN Grant button will be available.
AND User can click Grant button
AND Transaction Status updates to Approved
AND Decision updates to Granted
AND All other pending requests for the player will be automatically denied when the request is granted
AND If the request was in edit mode, the page will refresh in view mode
OR If the request was in view mode, the page will refresh in view mode
AND Will receive a blue notification message: "The Winter League Request has been granted."
AND When request is granted, "Agreement Reached" and checkbox will appear on the request
AND BOC Users receive a Notification when Request is Granted
Or Club Users receive a Notification when Request is Granted

title: As a User, I want to Deny a Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Winter League Request is in pending state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing or Editing the request
custom_expected:
THEN Deny(grey) button will be available in both View and Edit mode.
AND User can click Deny button
AND Transaction Status updates to Approved
AND Decision updates to Denied
AND No other request is modified as a result of denying this request
AND If the request was in edit mode, the page will refresh in view mode
OR If the request was in view mode, the page will refresh in view mode
AND Will receive a blue notification message: "The Winter League Request has been denied."
AND BOC Users receive a Notification when Request is Denied
AND Club Users receive a Notification when Request is Denied

title: As a BOC User, I want to delete a Winter League Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user has edit permission for the Winter League Request form in Preliminary and Pending to Club states
custom_steps: WHEN the form is in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should a "Delete" button on the form in grey
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this Winter League Request?
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken. 
AND Deleted transactions should not appear on the front end or be searchable.
AND Any Approval Items or Action Items related to the deleted Request should be deleted as well

title: As a BOC user, I want to be able to reverse or reverse and suppress a Winter League Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC logs in
AND Winter League Request is in Approved state
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the transaction in View or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN "Reverse" button will be available in grey
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. See Messages #79
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND If the Request was originally Granted, the decision on the Request is updated to be Denied.
OR If the Request was originally Denied, the decision on the Request is updated to be Granted.
AND BOC Admins will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Winter League History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.

title: As a User, I want to receive an email when a Winter League Request is submitted to club
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Winter League Request in Preliminary state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Submit to Club
custom_expected:
THEN upon submitting to club, an email is sent to users defined in the Email Utility
 - Subject: Winter League Request
 - Body: A Winter League Request has been received on " + requestDate + " from club " + fromTeam + " of the " + winterLeague + " for player " + playerName + "."
AND Emails are generated whether the Request was created in ebis or the Winter League Portal

title: As a User, I want to receive an error if the Winter League Team has 10 pending requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Winter League Request for a player
AND the Winter League Team on the request already had 10 pending requests
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks submit to Club
custom_expected:
THEN system should check for existing requests from Winter League Team in "Pending to Club" status
AND if user finds 10 or more of these requests then system should display message:"Invalid Winter League Request.  <club> currently have <number pending requests> pending Winter League Requests."
AND Hint Text should say:"The maximum is 10."  
AND Clicking Back should return the user to the entry point
AND clicking Override should submit the request

title: As a User, I want to receive an error if Player already has an Approved Winter League Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Winter League Request for a player
AND an APPROVED (granted or denied) winter league request already exists for the player for the current period
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to submit Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN if request is on or after 6/1, system should look from 6/1 of current year to 5/31 of next year
BUT if request is before 6/1, system should look from 6/1 of last year to 5/31 of current year
AND if system finds an Approved(granted or denied) Winter League Request for the player, for which an agreement was reached system should display message: "Invalid Winter League Request.  An agreement has already been reached for the Winter League Request granted on <date> for <club>."
BUT if system finds an Approved(granted or denied) Winter League Request for the player, for which an agreement was NOT reached system should display message: "Invalid Winter League Request.  A Request was previously Granted on <date> for <club>."

title: Winter League Requests Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC admin or BOC basic user
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Winter League Requests
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Admin users should be able to View, Create, Edit, Grant, Deny, Submit, Reverse, Delete and Search Winter League Requests
BUT BOC Basic Users should only be able to View and Search Winter League Requests

title: Winter League Requests Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as club basic or club admin user
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN Club Admin users should be able to  Grant, Deny, and  Update Winter League Requests
BUT Club Basic users should only be able to View and Search Winter League Requests

title: As a User, I want to search for Winter League Request Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Advance Search page
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Winter League Request" under "Search Type"
custom_expected:
THEN "Decision" will be the filters under the Transaction search type
AND Filter will be a Select2
AND Possible Values will be "Granted" and "Denied"
AND Conducting an advanced search will return the standard result columns for a transaction search
AND "Decision" will be included in the result columns

title: As a User, I want to receive an error if the player has an Offseason Assignment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Winter League Request for a player 
AND the player selected as an Offseason Assignment
custom_steps: WHEN user submits Winter League Request
custom_expected:
THEN if  the request is on or after 6/1, system should look for offseason assignments from 6/1 of current year to 5/31 of next year
BUT if request is before 6/1, system should look for offseason assignments from 6/1 of last year to 5/31 of current year
AND if an approved offseason assignment is found system should display message: "Invalid Winter League Request.  Player was assigned via an Offseason Assignment on <date> to play for <club>."

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Winter League Requests report
custom_preconds: GIVEN "Winter League Requests " is a report in the Report listing widget
custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch the prompts according to the requirements
AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements
AND the report should have an LDAP associated with it

title: As a User, I want new Winter League Requests entered into the WLP to be sent to ebis
custom_preconds: GIVEN a RESTful interface for the Winter League Portal exists in EBIS
custom_steps: WHEN a new Request is created in the WLP
custom_expected:
THEN the following fields should be sent to ebis:
 -- Player First Name
 -- Player Last Name
 -- ebisID (player ID)
 -- Requesting Team (ebis club ID)
 -- Status: Requested
 -- Request Date
AND a new Winter League Request should be created and submitted to Club in ebis, with all relevant submission updates being performed as though it was submitted within ebis, including the appropriate notifications and action items

title: As a User, I want the cancellation of Requests in the WLP sent back to EBIS
custom_preconds: GIVEN a RESTful interface exists in EBIS for cancelling a Winter League Request in the Winter League Portal
custom_steps: WHEN a Winter League Request is cancelled in in the WLP
custom_expected:
THEN fields passed in should match the fields passed in for a new request
AND the fields passed in should be:
-- ebisID (player ID)
-- Requesting Team (ebis club ID)
-- Request Date
AND system should find pending to club requests that match the passed in data
AND these requests in EBIS should be deleted
AND system should return a generic JSON object to WLP with a boolean indicating success/failure as well as a list of error messages

title: As a User, I want Agreements Reached sent to ebis
custom_preconds: GIVEN a RESTful interface exists in EBIS for "Agreements Reached" on a Granted Winter League Request in the Winter League Portal
custom_steps: WHEN an agreement is reached on a granted Winter League Request in in the WLP
custom_expected:
THEN fields passed in should match the fields passed in for a new request 
AND fields passed in should be:
 -- ebisID (player ID)
 -- Requesting Team (ebis club ID)
 -- Request Date
 -- Agreement Reached Flag
 AND agreement Reached checkbox should be checked on the Winter League Request in EBIS
AND system should return a generic JSON object to WLP with a boolean indicating success/failure as well as a list of error messages

title: As a User, I want the granting of Requests sent back to the WLP
custom_preconds: GIVEN RESTful service between EBIS and WLP for granting requests
custom_steps: WHEN a Request is granted in EBIS
custom_expected:
THEN the following fields should be sent to the WLP
 -- ebisID (player_id)
 -- Requesting Team (club_id)
 -- Request Date (request_date)
 -- Status: G  (status)
 -- Username granting/denying (username)
 AND the fields should be sent as a JSON object with field names noted in parens above

title: As a User, I want the denying of Requests sent back to the WLP
custom_preconds: GIVEN RESTful service between EBIS and WLP for denying requests
custom_steps: WHEN a Request is denied in EBIS
custom_expected:
THEN the following fields should be sent to the WLP:
 -- ebisID (player_id)
 -- Requesting Team (club_id)
 -- Request Date (request_date)
 -- Status: D  (status)
 -- Username granting/denying (username)
AND the fields should be sent as a JSON object with field names noted in parens above

title: Winter League ETL
custom_preconds: GIVEN ETL for Winter League request data has been run into EBIS 2.5
custom_steps: WHEN user views any field related to WLRs that have been brought over from EBIS1
custom_expected: THEN all data values in EBIS 2.5 should match the values in EBIS1

title: Winter League Request Bridging
As a user, I want a custom reports popup for running the DL Summary Report from the reports widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions to print DL Summary Report
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Disabled List Summary Report" link from the reports listing widget
custom_expected:
THEN a custom EBIS UI prompt modal should display (similar to modal for other reports)
AND prompt filters should match what's listed in the data discovery (https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5645+Report+Prompts)
AND running the report with the desired prompts should print the report matching the Details and Layout Listed in the wiki (https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5642+Report+Details , https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5641+Report+Layout)

title: As a user I want to be able to run the DL Recert Report from Recertification screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Recertification utility
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the "DL Recertification" tab for BOC and Club users
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Run Report" button. 
AND Clicking this will launch the report prompt for the DL Recertification Maintenance report.
AND The prompt should default to the current year and allow the user to adjust the parameters and run the report, just like if they accessed this from the Report screen.

title: As a user I want to be able to sort the Recertification utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Recertification utility
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the header of any column in the Recertification screen
custom_expected:
THEN system will sort by the column. 
AND For the Recert due column, the sort should be on the first date displayed. 
AND Column headers should now be blue
AND The column being sorted on should have global styling added(grey background and the red up/down arrow next to the column header)

title: As a User, I want to Navigate to and view the filter section of the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN "Arb Eligibles" appears as a tab under the Major Contracts dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the Major Contracts link in the left nav
custom_expected:
THEN system should open the dashboard
AND the tabs should appear in alpha order
AND the layout of the Utility should match the provided wireframe
AND the fields should match the provided data discovery

title: As a User, I want to view Past Year Results on Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to select a past year from the Year filter
 AND clicking View button should load the utility with players from the year selected
 AND population displayed should also meet the criteria set by the other filters
 AND the layout of the result columns should match the provided wireframe
 AND the columns should match the provided data discovery

title: As a User, I want to view the Arb Status filter on Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user views Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN system should allow user to filter utility population based on players' status
 AND possible values should match the provided Data Discovery
 AND mapping should follow the attached Salary Arb Status Chart

title: As a User, I want to view the Signed/Unsigned filter on Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user views Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN system should allow user to filter utility population based on players' status
 AND possible values should match the provided Data Discovery

title: As a User, I want to view the Elig Count filter on Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user views Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN system should allow user to filter utility population based on players' Eligible Count
 AND possible values should match the provided Data Discovery
AND logic for determining Elig Count should be pulled from ebis1

title: As a User, I want to Update the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'Edit' button on the Utility
custom_expected:
THEN system will reload the utility in Edit Mode
AND All of the filters will become disabled when the form is in edit mode
AND The columns that are editable will match the provided wire and data discovery (not all columns are editable)

title: As a User, I want to save changes to the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN enters new value and clicks on 'Save' button
custom_expected:
THEN system will save all of the entered values, and reload the utility in View mode
AND A successful blue notification should also display.

title: As a User, I want to View the Hearing Info modal on the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'INFO' button on a Player's row
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the Hearing Info modal
AND The layout of the modal will match the provided wireframe
AND The fields will match the provided data discovery
AND If the Arb Utility is in view mode when the modal is opened, the modal will be in view mode
AND If the Arb Utility is in edit mode when the modal is opened, the modal will be in edit mode
AND Clicking the Ok button or the 'X' will close the modal

title: As a User, I want to Update the Hearing Info modal on the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'INFO' button on a Player's row
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the player's Hearing Info modal in edit mode
AND The editable fields will match the provided data discovery and wire
AND Clicking the Ok button or the 'X' will close the modal and retain the changes made to the modal
AND Clicking 'Cancel' will close the modal and discard the changes made to the modal
AND The Info button will appear blue for players who have data entered into their modal

title: As a User, I want to Save updates made to the Hearing Info modal on the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'INFO' button on a Player's row to open the Hearing info Modal in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Ok button and an 'X' icon
AND When either one is the clicked, the modal will close, retaining any changes made
AND When the modal is closed, the Utility will still be in edit mode
AND There will be a Save button on the Utility
AND Clicking Save will save all changes, including those made to the Modal, and reload the utility in View mode
AND There will be a Cancel button on the Utility
AND Clicking Cancel will call all changes, including those made to the Modal, and reload the utility in View mode

title: As a User, I want to switch between different player's Hearing Info modals on the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility edit mode
AND the system allows users to quickly enter Hearing Details and Filing Numbers for each player without having to open and close each player's modal
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'INFO' button on a Player's row to open the Hearing info Modal(both edit and view mode)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Previous button and a Next button
AND Clicking the Previous button will refresh the Modal with the hearing info of the previous player appearing in the utility
OR Clicking the Next button will refresh the Modal with the hearing info of the next player appearing in the utility
AND If any data had been entered, it will be retained when the player is switched

title: Rule to Prevent Saving the Utility with Blank Rows
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for editing the Arbitration Eligible Utility
AND user is viewing the utility in edit mode
AND user has added a new row to the utility
BUT user has NOT entered a player name in the new row
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN system should run required field rule check on "Player Name"
AND system should throw a blocker message preventing user from saving utility
AND clicking Back should return the user to the utility in edit mode

title: As a BOC User, I want to delete a player from the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in Edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'Delete' button next to a player (Delete icon is available on each player's row.)
custom_expected:
THEN system will remove the player from the arb list
AND If the user saves their updates, the Utility will reload in view mode and the player will not appear in the list
AND If the user cancels their updates, the Utility will reload in view mode and the player will return to the list
NOTE: This can be done at any time, even after the results are marked final

title: As a User, I want to finalize the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in Edit or View mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Finalize button on the Utility in both Edit and View Mode
custom_expected:
THEN system locks the Utility and prevent Club users from making updates 
AND Stops the population from updating automatically (no players added or removed)

title: Arb Eligibles Utility Permissions - BOC MJ Contracts
custom_preconds: GIVEN Arb Eligibles Utility permission varies for different BOC users
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Admin will have the following permission 
 - View, Update, Finalize
AND BOC Basic will have the following permission
 - View

title: As a User, I want to Initialize Arb Eligible Tables for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility 
AND user is viewing the Arb Eligible Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user chooses a year that has not been initialized
custom_expected:
THEN all filters (not Year) should be disabled 
AND an Initialize button should be available
 AND clicking Initialize should load the arb eligibles tables
AND this should include setting Arb Status and Elig Counts, based on calculations provided by Dev
 AND after Initialize is clicked, all filters should become active

title: As a User, I want the Arb Eligibles tables to get updated when transactions that affect arb eligibility occur
custom_preconds: GIVEN a transaction exists that impacts the Arb Eligibility
custom_steps: WHEN a transaction occurs that affects arb eligibility
custom_expected:
THEN the arb eligible table should be updated
 AND this should include but should not be limited to adding players, removing players, setting Elig Counts, and updating Arb Status

title: Arbitration ETL
custom_preconds: GIVEN an ETL for Arbitration data has been run into EBIS 2.5 from EBIS 1
custom_steps: WHEN user views any field related to Arbitration that has been brought over from EBIS1
custom_expected: THEN values in all fields brought over to EBIS 2.5 should match values populated in EBIS 1

title: As a user I want hitting cancel to trigger a modal asking me to confirm that I want to cancel changes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is in Arb Eligible Utility in edit mode
and user makes some changes
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Cancel
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking cancel while in edit mode will trigger the "Are you sure modal"
AND Clicking yes cancels changes and toggles the form back to view mode
AND Clicking no dismisses the modal and the form remains in edit mode

title: As a user I want Finalizing the arb utility to trigger a modal asking me to confirm that I want to Finalize
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in arb utility
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Finalize
custom_expected:
THEN system will trigger the "Are you sure modal"
AND Clicking yes cancels changes and toggles the form back to view mode
AND Clicking no dismisses the modal and the user is returned to the form

title: As a User, I want to export the Arb Eligibles Utility to excel
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions for the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Export button on the form
AND Clicking the Export button will run the Arb Eligibles Utility Export Report

title: Arbitration Bridging
As a user I want to always see the table headers when scrolling through Arbitration eligible players
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is view Arbitration eligible players list in arb utility
custom_steps: WHEN user scrolls through Arbitration eligible players table
custom_expected:
THEN user should see the table headers when scrolling through
AND the table should have a fixed height and show 8-10 rows of data at a time

title: As a user I want to see arrows on the previous and next buttons on the info modal
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the Hearing Info modal in edit or view mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should see arrows on the previous and next buttons on the info modal

Wireframe:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=hearing_modal

title: As a BOC User, I want to add a player to the Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC user is in Arb Eligibles Utility in Edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'Add Player' button on the page
custom_expected:
THEN system will add a new row to the bottom utility
AND the table will auto scroll to the newly added row
AND the Player column of the new row will be an autocomplete search that mimics the global quick search functionality (both in display and population)
AND Selecting a player will populate the following columns:
 -- Org
 -- EOS MLS
 -- Pos
 -- Elig Count
 -- Arb Status (if applicable, if not leave blank)
 -- PY Salary
 -- PY+1 (if applicable, if not leave blank)
NOTE: This can be done at any time, even after the results are marked final

title: Arb Eligibles Utility Permissions - Club MJ Contracts
custom_preconds: GIVEN Arb Eligibles Utility permission varies for different Club users
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Arb Eligibles Utility
custom_expected:
THEN Club Admin will have the following permission
 - View, Update
AND Club Basic will have the following permission
 - View

title: As a user I want merging 2 International Player profiles to send the information to LARI
custom_preconds: GIVEN an International Player Profile has already been sent to LARI
custom_steps: WHEN the International Player Profile associated with a player ID a that has already been sent to LARI is merged with another International Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the information should be communicated to LARI. 
AND fields and methods of communication should follow documentation found here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4.1+Profile+fields

title: Fix UI of Advanced Search for smaller screens
custom_preconds: GIVEN user logs in on screen sizes below 768px
custom_steps: WHEN the user goes to Advanced Search
custom_expected:
THEN Remove the ">" to the right of Search For
AND Move the Search for dropdown beneath the text Search for
AND Move the Saved Searches dropdown beneath the Search for dropdown
AND Make the Search button span the full width of the button container

Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=mobile_2

title: As a User, I want to Export the DL Summary Report to Excel
custom_preconds: GIVEN  EBIS1 "Run Excel Report" version of the "Disabled List Summary Report" has been replicated in EBIS2
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to reports widget
custom_expected:
THEN the popup to run the "Disabled List Summary Report" report should have a "Run Excel" button which generates this document
AND  columns and layout of the printed excel report will match ebis1

title: Update Draft & Scouting tab title to be consistent on all profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on Professional/ Domestic Amateur Player Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Draft & Scouting tab of the player profile
custom_expected:
THEN Professional profile tab should read Draft & Scouting
AND Domestic Amateur profile tab should read Draft & Scouting
